pageTitle: Daniel Welsh: Santa Barbara Athletics - UCSBGauchos.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {23316=2012: Started 17 games on the backline for the Gauchos, tied for the most among the team's defenders ... Picked up assists at Loyola Marymount on Aug. 26 and at Seattle on Sep. 16 ... Contributed to four UCSB clean sheets ... Named to the All-Big West Second Team., 22560=2013: For the second straight season, Welsh anchored the UCSB center back pairing after dealing with injuries to Peter Schmetz ... Appeared in all but one game for the Gauchos, starting 18 ... Picked up an assist in a 2-0 win against UC Riverside on Oct. 6 ... Allowed one goal or less in five of six games to close the season after pairing with Nick DePuy in the back ... Named to the Top Drawer Soccer Team of the Week on Nov. 12 after shutting down Cal Poly's Mackenzie Pridham in a nationally televised 2-0 win over the Mustangs ... Saw time at right back for short spells in the middle of the season ... Named to the College Sports Madness All-Big West First Team after the season., 23619=UMBC Attended University of Maryland Baltimore County for his first two years of college…Garnered 2011 NSCAA All-Northeast Region Third Team, 2011 All-America East Second Team, and 2010 America East All-Rookie Team honors while playing with the Retrievers…Scored two goals during his freshman campaign and made a total of 29 starts in two seasons with UMBC…Helped his team to an America East Tournament title and an NCAA Tournament Second Round appearance in 2010…Was named to the 2011 America East All-Tournament Team and the BWI Classic All-Tournament Team., 25267=PERSONAL Daniel Welsh was born on March 25, 1991 in Dundee, Scotland…Parents are Brian and Susan Welsh…Has two younger siblings, Michael and Christopher…Is majoring in sociology at UCSB…Has aspirations of playing professional soccer…When he is not playing soccer, he enjoys relaxing, listening to music, and hanging out with his friends…Can’t do without his phone…Listens to music before each game…Can best be described as “easygoing” and “dedicated”…His most memorable sporting moments include captaining his country and winning his first national title…Wants people to know that he is, “proud to be a Gaucho”…Would love to play on the same pitch as Sergio Ramos, Lionel Messi and Andres Iniesta…Cheers for Manchester City and his favorite athletes are Lionel Messi and Vincent Kompany…Favorite movie is “Braveheart”…Enjoys watching FOX Soccer…Favorite read is George Best’s autobiography. , 22413=UC Santa Barbara 2012 All Big-West Second Team 2013 College Sports Madness All-Big West First Team}
